article:
George Washington Carver was a teacher. He was famous _  he was very clever. Some students wanted to trick their famous _ . They got some insects  . These insects were not the same kind. In fact, they were all  _ . The students took parts from each insect. Then they put the parts together. They made a(n)  _ insect!
The _  took the fake   insect to Carver. "Mr. Carver," they said. "We _  an insect. We don't know what it is. Please _ us, Mr. Carver."
Carver looked at the insect. He said, "I  _  what this insect is. This is a trick insect!" Carver was not  _ .
He liked to joke with his students. In fact, Carver took good care of his students. He helped them in the  _ , and he helped them out of school. Carter was so clever that he even taught farmers how to grow good crops .
